info.title: Creating a virtual network with an existing bridge

abstract.para: This topic describes how to create a virtual network attached to an existing network bridge using &libvirt;.

topic.para: Virtual machines (VMs) need a virtual network that uses the network bridge br0 to be able to communicate via a VXLAN attached to that bridge. Run the following procedure on &productnameshort; hosts to add such virtual network to the &libvirtd; service.

listitem.para: You installed &libvirt; virtualization tools and the &libvirtd; service is enabled and started.
You configured the network bridge br0 with the VXLAN attached on &productnameshort;.

step.para: Create a temporary XML file (for example, /tmp/vxlan1-br0.xml) that defines a new virtual network. The file should be similar to the following one:
Use the XML file to create a new &libvirt;-based virtual network.
Remove the XML definition file from disk, it is no longer needed.
Start the new vxlan1-br0 virtual network and configure it to start automatically when the &libvirtd; service starts.
Verify the status of the newly created network. If the newly created virtual network is listed as active, the configuration was successful.
step.screen: &prompt.sudo;virsh net-list Name State Autostart Persistent ---------------------------------------------------- vxlan1-br0 active yes yes
